info.title: RecordM API
info.description:
The RecordM REST API

**Note**: To use the 'Try it out' buttons, you must be [logged in](/).

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.summary: Retrieves a specific definition including its fields.
get.description: Retrieves the full details about a specific definition. When setting export to true it will return a clone of the definition.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: If a value is given, it will be compared to the current version of the definition and if they are equal, a 304 will be returned.

parameters.name: export
parameters.description: When true it will return a clone of the definition

304.description: The version of the definition matches the If-None-Match HTTP Header. No definition is returned.

requestBody.description: The definition object with the updated details

200.description: The updated definition with field definitions

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation
The user is not allowed to perfom the operation
The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.description: Retrieves a sinple representation of all enabled definitions by default.  To include disabled definitions set the query parameter `includeDisbaled` to true.  The result will not include the field definitions.

parameters.name: includeDisabled
parameters.description: If it should include inactive definitions

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Restrict results to definitons with name matching

200.description: A simple representation of the definition without field definitions
A simple representation of the definition created without field definitions

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.summary: Retrieves a specific that match a provided name.
get.description: Retrieves the full details about a definition.

401.description: If there was an unauthorized access.

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

404.description: No definition could be found matching the provided name

put.summary: Change the state of an existing definition

200.description: The updated definition with field definitions

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.description: The preferred endpoint for searches. Search instances of a definition specified either by id or by name, using ES query_string. Supports multiple sorts.See [the ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/query-dsl-query-string-query.html#query-string-syntax) for syntax details.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the number of results to return

post.description: Search the definition specified either by id or name, using a structured ES search request. See [the ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/query-dsl.html) for details on query syntax.

parameters.name: typed_keys
parameters.description: When asking for aggregations, should they be prefixed with the aggregation type? The same behaviour as specified in [ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/search-aggregations.html#return-agg-type)

requestBody.description: The JSON of the ES query.

get.description: Stream through all the results of a Definition search. Useful when needing to process more than the 10.000 results available through the normal search. The arguments are the same as on a normal search, excluding `size` and `from`, that are not needed.

post.description: Stream through all the results of a Definition search. Useful when needing to process more than the 10.000 results available through the normal search. Accepts a structured ES search request. See [the ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/query-dsl.html) for details on query syntax.Does NOT accept aggregations, use the normal search endpoint for them.

requestBody.description: The JSON of the ES query.

put.summary: Add a new definition to an existing domain
put.description: The response will return the domain with its definitions but not with it's field definitions.

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

delete.summary: Remove a definition from an existing domain
delete.description: The response will return the domain with its definitions but not with it's field definitions.

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.description: It will include all definitions belonging to this domain but the definitions will not include it's field definitions.

304.description: The version of the definition matches the If-None-Match HTTP Header. No definition is returned.

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.summary: Retrieve a domain by it's identifier
get.description: It will include all definitions belonging to this domain but the definitions will not include it's field definitions.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: If a value is given, it will be compared to the current version of the domain and if they are equal, a 304 will be returned.

304.description: The version of the definition matches the If-None-Match HTTP Header. No definition is returned.

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation
The user is not allowed to perfom the operation
The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.description: It will include all definitions belonging to this domain but the definitions will not include it's field definitions.

403.description: The user is not allowed to perfom the operation

get.description: Search instances of all definitions of a Domain, specified either by id or by name, using ES query_string. Supports multiple sorts.See [the ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/query-dsl-query-string-query.html#query-string-syntax) for syntax details.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the number of results to return

post.description: Search instances of all definitions of a Domain, specified either by id or name, using a structured ES search request. See [the ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/query-dsl.html) for details on query syntax.

requestBody.description: The JSON of the ES query.

get.description: Stream through all the results of a Domain search. Useful when needing to process more than the 10.000 results available through the normal search. The arguments are the same as on a normal search, excluding `size` and `from`, that are not needed.

post.description: Stream through all the results of a Definition search. Useful when needing to process more than the 10.000 results available through the normal search. Accepts a structured ES search request. See [the ES docs](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/query-dsl.html) for details on query syntax.Does NOT accept aggregations, use the normal search endpoint for them.

requestBody.description: The JSON of the ES query.

post.description: Adds a new instance represented by the passed Object.

200.description: A JSON object that can contain warnings thrown when creating

404.description: The specified definition in the instance JSON was not found.

post.description: Adds a LogM log entry to an instance.

get.description: Obtains a representation of an instance.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: If a value is given, it will be compared to the current version of the instance and if they are equal, a 304 will be returned.

200.description: The instance was found and a representation of the instance is returned.

304.description: The version of the instance matches the If-None-Match HTTP Header. No instance is returned.

404.description: An instance with the specified id was not found.

put.description: Updates an instance with the complete representation passed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the instance to update

200.description: A JSON object that can contain warnings thrown when updating

400.description: Some error ocurred while trying to update

text/plain.example: "Version null not allowed" OR [Field errors,...] OR [Integration errors,...]

500.description: There were errors updating the instance

503.description: Outdated $extRef fields were accepted but could not be updated

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the instance to delete

parameters.name: ignoreRefs
parameters.description: If ignoreRefs is true, then the instance will be deleted even if other instances are referencing it. Otherwise an error will be returned if there are instances with a reference to it.

get.summary: Download file from field in instance
get.description: Download a file that is attached to a $file field

parameters.name: fieldDefinitionId
parameters.description: The id of the field definition of the $file field

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The filename of the file to download.

parameters.name: disposition
parameters.description: The Content-Disposition to use when downloading the file. Only useful when used as link in a webpage, to control if it should be downloaded or shown inline.

404.description: Either the instance or the file were not found. The response message will have more details.

get.description: Obtains a representation of an instance with no values. Useful for using as a starting point for creating a new instance.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the definition of which we want the empty instance.

parameters.name: withDefaults
parameters.description: If true, all the fields with defined default values will have them already filled. If false, all the fields will have empty values.

404.description: The specified definition was not found.

post.summary: Upload file to field in instance
post.description: Upload a file to be used as a value for a $file field

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: When uploading to an existing instance, it's the id of the instance. When uploading for an instance that doesn't yet exist, it should be an UUID that matches the one the instance will have on creation. This way the already uploaded files will be moved to the final destination.

parameters.name: fieldDefinitionId
parameters.description: The id of the field definition of the $file field

200.description: The upload was done successfully. For compatibility with IE, the response wraps the uploaded filename in a <textarea/>.

put.description: Updates the matching instances with the passed updates.

requestBody.description: A JSON doc of the specified format

400.description: The body doesn't contain type and/or condition fields.

200.description: A summary of the operations performed

post.description: Adds a new instance represented by the passed Object.

requestBody.description: A JSON doc of the specified format

400.description: The body doesn't contain a type field.

404.description: No definition was found that matches the type field.

delete.description: Deletes the instances that match the condition.

requestBody.description: A JSON doc of the specified format

400.description: The body doesn't contain type and/or condition fields.

200.description: A summary of the operations performed

type.description: The name of the Definition where to create the instances.

values.description: An object in which the keys are the field names, and the values are the values to be used to fill the fields.

example.Parent Field/Other Field: value for an Other Field that is descendent of any Parent Field
example.Parent Field=parent value/Other Field: value for an Other Field that is descendent of a Parent Field with value 'parent value'

waitForSearchAvailability.description: A flag that makes the return wait for the record to be available for searching

type.description: The name of the Definition of the instances we are updating.

condition.description: A condition to match the instances to update. Can be either an ES query string, or the special value "recordmInstanceId:N[@V]" to match a single instance. If the optional '@V' is used, the update will only take place if the instance N is at version V.

values.description: An object in which the keys are the field IDs or field paths, and the values are the values to be used to fill the fields.

example.Parent Field/Other Field: value for an Other Field that is descendent of any Parent Field
example.Parent Field=parent value/Other Field: value for an Other Field that is descendent of a Parent Field with value 'parent value'

type.description: The name of the Definition of the instances we are deleting.

condition.description: A condition to match the instances to delete. Can be either an ES query string, or the special value "recordmInstanceId:N[@V]" to match a single instance. If the optional '@V' is used, the update will only take place if the instance N is at version V.

ignoreRefs.description: See the Instance DELETE for details.

attachmentPath.description: The relative path for the Instance's attached files. Normally the id of the instance.
The relative path for the Instance's attached files. Normally the id of the instance.
